5. Identify which venue has the lowest crowd: Compare the 'crowd' values for each of these teams' matches. In our table, we observe that Prince Park (Carlton) had 29500 attendees, whereas Victoria Park (Collingwood) had 12000 attendees.

6. Determine the answer to the claim: Since the crowd at Prince Park was higher than the crowd at Victoria Park, it means that Prince Park did not record the lowest crowd participation during the 1949 VFL season.
